        • check on startup

        Archived

        This topic is now archived and is closed to further replies.

        check on startup

        By RobMan, July 25, 2007 in General

        • Start new topic

        Recommended Posts

        RobMan    0

        RobMan    0

        • Newbie
        • Members
        • 0
        • 5 posts
        • Report post
        Posted July 25, 2007

        I'm using uTorrent since 2 weeks and it's great!

        Only...I'm downloading a torrent with a total of 73GB and everytime uTorrent starts up it is checking the files so you get the status 'checked ...%'

        This takes a lot of CPU and time because it is 73GB to be checked!

        Can I disable the check at start up?

        Share this post

        Link to post
        Share on other sites

        DreadWingKnight    307

        DreadWingKnight    307

        • -------
        • Administrators
        • 307
        • 43,158 posts
        • Report post
        Posted July 25, 2007

        You can't disable it, but you can prevent it by fixing whatever it is that is preventing uT from saving its resume data.

        Share this post

        Link to post
        Share on other sites

        RobMan    0

        RobMan    0

        • Newbie
        • Members
        • 0
        • 5 posts
        • Report post
        Posted July 25, 2007

        Could you explain what you mean with:

        ''but you can prevent it by fixing whatever it is that is preventing uT from saving its resume data.''

        Thanks!

        Share this post

        Link to post
        Share on other sites

        DreadWingKnight    307

        DreadWingKnight    307

        • -------
        • Administrators
        • 307
        • 43,158 posts
        • Report post
        Posted July 25, 2007

        Some antivirus, firewall and antispyware applications prevent uTorrent from writing its resume file. They need to either allow the write or be removed.

        Non-graceful shutdowns of uTorrent also prevent the writing of the resume file. Make sure uT shuts down cleanly.

        Share this post

        Link to post
        Share on other sites

        RobMan    0

        RobMan    0

        • Newbie
        • Members
        • 0
        • 5 posts
        • Report post
        Posted July 26, 2007

        Thanks

        Share this post

post_text.surface_form: I'm using uTorrent since 2 weeks and it's great! Only...I'm downloading a torrent with a total of 73GB and everytime uTorrent starts up it is checking the files so you get the status 'checked ...%' This takes a lot of CPU and time because it is 73GB to be checked! Can I disable the check at start up?
You can't disable it, but you can prevent it by fixing whatever it is that is preventing uT from saving its resume data.
Could you explain what you mean with: ''but you can prevent it by fixing whatever it is that is preventing uT from saving its resume data.'' Thanks!

Some antivirus, firewall and antispyware applications prevent uTorrent from writing its resume file. They need to either allow the write or be removed. Non-graceful shutdowns of uTorrent also prevent the writing of the resume file. Make sure uT shuts down cleanly.
